doc.field: This series contains a small collection of audio-visual material, primarily audio cassettes. Most of the cassettes represent interviews conducted by Victor Navasky as a part of his research for Naming Names. Among those interviewed are Frank Donner, Walter Bernstein, Albert Maltz, and Estelle Foreman. Of the twenty audio cassettes associated with Naming Names, sixteen were initially digitized and may be accessed by researchers. Four of the original interview cassettes had no identification and have not been digitized. Among the remaining audio cassettes in this series are a Rosenberg debate held at Swarthmore in 1996 and "A Conversation with I.F. Stone at 80," an event sponsored by The Nation Institute and The New School in 1987. Other formats include one VHS tape - Children of the Left (Eric Stange, 1989) and five reel-to-reel tapes, one of which is labeled "McCarthy."
